page.title: 18Recreation Facilities
page.content: The football stadium where 4th division Chester play, and the Greyhound Stadium where 100 dogs race each week stand side-by-side on Sealand Road. They not only attract spectators to their sports, but promising local boys may join the City Juniors club who train at Chester's ground. Several locals keep greyhounds and may enter the races held on Monday and Saturday evenings if accepted at trials. Residents must travel outside the D-block to swim or use indoor sports facilities. The nearest being at the Northgate Arena in Chester. The public may use playing fields at Blacon High and the former Bishop's school. There are also several open spaces for casual use by locals some with swings etc. The adventure playground on Kipling Rd is the best.
